intro: Parablechnum proliferum, commonly known as the creeping broom. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, bright yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has compound leaves with small leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ability to spread vegetatively makes it a common and persistent species in its native range.
